intro: Willoughbya scabra, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Willoughbya scabra is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
